text:
I'm trying to convert the following
```:(1 <> 2)```
into
```:(1 != 2)```
in order to build an Excel formula syntax to Julia syntax converter. But since the first is a syntax error in Julia, I don't know how to prevent a syntax error when building a macro like:
```@xl 1 <> 2```

text: This is not possible, arguments to macros still have to be valid Julia syntax. You could perhaps use a custom string literal instead

elements.text: This is not possible, arguments to macros still have to be valid Julia syntax. You could perhaps use a custom string literal instead

text: Do you perhaps know of a good tutorial for custom string literals?

elements.text: Do you perhaps know of a good tutorial for custom string literals?

text: The manual has a section on them: <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/metaprogramming/#Non-Standard-String-Literals>
